info.title: Arplace API
info.description: This API provides endpoints used for the arplace apps

post.summary: Upload an asset to the server

get.summary: gets asset with given IDs

put.summary: update asset information for the given IDs

delete.summary: deletes the asset with the given ID from the server

post.summary: Get a list of VirtualAssets with specified IDs
Returns the layers with given ids

get.summary: Returns a list of all layers available to the current user

post.summary: Creates a layer
post.description: Creates a new layer with the current user as owner and returns the created layer object containing the id

get.summary: Lists all followers of a layer

post.summary: Adds the current user to the followers

delete.summary: Removes the current user from the followers

get.summary: List users with their member status to the given layer

post.summary: Invites the users in the request-list to the layer
Accepts an open invite for the layer
Rejects an open invite for the layer
Sets the preview image of the layer with the specified id

get.summary: Lists all members of a layer including their permissions

post.summary: Adds the current user to the layers members if the layer visibility is public

200.description: Current user added to the layer

put.summary: Overwrites all members of a layer including their permissions

patch.summary: Updates all members of a layer including their permissions

delete.summary: Removes the current user from the layers members

200.description: Current user removed from the layer

delete.summary: Removes the given {userId} from the layer members

get.summary: Gives a list of available roles
Lists assets of a layer
Returns all assets in the user library

post.summary: Adds specified assets to the user library

get.summary: Returns the number of assets in "my objects"

delete.summary: Deletes the specified asset owned by the user

get.summary: Returns all available virtual assets from the marketplace. Further filtered by query if given.

post.summary: Adds the specified user assets to the marketplace

get.summary: Returns the number of available virtual assets in the marketplace.

delete.summary: Removes the specified user asset from the marketplace

post.summary: Places a virtual asset from the library in the world

get.summary: Returns all placements of a given location (lat,long) sorted by distance.

parameters.name: filter[layer.ids]
parameters.description: Only returns layers given in filter

get.summary: Get the current user profile

put.summary: Updates the password of the current user profile

post.summary: Sets the preview image of the current user
Creates a session
post.description: Stores the content data from the request body and returns the created session id

get.summary: Get a sessions data

put.description: The content data for the specified session is updated. Returns 404 if no session with the specified id was found

get.summary: Lists all followers of the current user

post.summary: Follows the users with the specified ids

delete.summary: Unfollows the user with the specified id

get.summary: Lists all friends of the current user

delete.summary: Deletes the friend with given id

get.summary: Get pending friend requests

post.summary: Sends a friend request to the users with the specified user ids
Accept a pending friend request
Refuses a pending friend request
Lists all public user information of given ids

get.summary: Returns all available layers for the current user. Further filtered by query if given.
Lists all available notifications for the current user

post.summary: Marks all given notification with boolean flag read

get.summary: Lists all available countries to choose from along with their flag icons

post.summary: Gets an array of random username suggestions from the API
Checks if the email is available for use or already occupied by another account
Checks if the username is available for use or already occupied by another account
Login the user
Refresh the APIToken using a refresh-token
Tries to register a new account
Starts the flow for resetting a users password

get.summary: Fetches the user, that the token was made for, from the API if the token is still valid

post.summary: Sends the token that was received via mail and the new password to the server to be checked

get.summary: Returns a list of all available users

QueryLimit.name: limit
QueryLimit.description: The number of records to return

QueryStart.name: start
QueryStart.description: The number of records to skip

QueryAssetIDs.name: ids
QueryAssetIDs.description: array of assetIDs to be fetched

emailVerified.description: Set to true if the user's email has been verified.

APIUser.description: All publicly available data of a user

APIIDField.description: unique ID of the respective resource

containedAssetIDs.description: The IDs of assets contained in this session

GoodBaseSchema.description: Base definition of any "positive" API response, defining only the data field.

BadBaseSchema.description: Base definition of any "negative" API response, defining only the error field.

APIListResponse.description: Definition of the APIResponse base class, that any other response derives from

APILayerSchema.description: Defines responses containing data of a single layer

APILayerListSchema.description: Defines responses containing data of multiple layers

APIAssetListSchema.description: Defines responses containing data of multiple assets

APIUserSchema.description: Defines responses containing data of a single user

APIUserListSchema.description: Defines responses containing data of multiple users

APIPlacementSchema.description: Defines responses containing data of a single placement

APIPlacementListSchema.description: Defines responses containing data of multiple placements

APIAssetSchema.description: Defines responses containing data of a single asset

APIImageURL.description: Defines the URL of an image within the API

APIImage.description: Defines an image to be uploaded to the API

APICountryListSchema.description: Defines responses containing data of multiple countries

APIAvailabilityFlag.description: Responds true if requested resource is available, false otherwise

APIEnableUserUploadFlag.description: Responds true if user is allowed to upload, false otherwise

APIResetToken.description: Defines the token that was sent via mail for resetting a users forgotten password

APINotification.description: Data included in a single notification

APINotFoundError.description: 404: The specified resource was not found

NotFoundError.description: 404: The specified resource was not found

APIAccesstokenResponse.description: Contains the access- and refresh-token along with other arguments

APIAssetListResponseWithInfos.description: Contains data of multiple assets, with additional infos if requested asset could not be found

APIUserResponse.description: Contains public data of a single user

APIUserListResponse.description: Contains public data of multiple users

APICountryListResponse.description: Defines responses containing data of multiple APICountry elements

APIPasswordResetResponse.description: Might (in the future) contain data regarding forgotten password resetting

APIResetTokenUserResponse.description: the username of the user for whom the token was created

APINotificationListResponse.description: Defines responses containing data of multiple APINotification elements

APINotificationResponse.description: Defines responses containing data of a single APINotification element

APIUserRoleListResponse.description: Defines responses containing data of multiple users and their roles

APIUserLayerMemberStatusListResponse.description: Defines responses containing data of multiple users with their layer membership status

APIRoleListResponse.description: Defines responses containing a list of available roles

APIAssetCountResponse.description: Defines responses containing the number of assets in a layer

jwt_auth.description: JWT authentication scheme using bearer tokens. Tokens are issued by the server upon successful authentication and are required for accessing protected resources.

tags.name: auth
tags.description: Endpoints for any data that has to be requested by unauthenticated users

tags.name: layers
tags.description: Endpoints for any layer-related interactions like CRUD & follow

tags.name: placements
tags.description: Endpoints for any placement-related interactions like placing or moving objects in AR

tags.name: user
tags.description: Endpoints for personal, user-related features like friends and followers

tags.name: users
tags.description: Endpoints for features around globally available users
